page.title: 16OCKBROOK VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Village life has been greatly affected by the building of the{Borrowash {by-pass}which cut off the southern end of {Cole Lane}from the rest of the village.South of the by-pass people identify themselves more with Borrowash and use the many amenities available there.North of the by-pass the amenities are few.Although there are some shops, most people shop outside the village especially since the building of a hypermarket 3 or 4 miles away.There is quick vehicular access to Derby Nottingham and M1.With little or no work in the village, people have to travel to work.As the bus service only starts at 09.30(half hourly),villagers are obliged to use private transport.Those staying in the village have only church groups and the Women's Institute to occupy them. Ockbrook can be a very lonely place.
